article_title: A More Natural Political Fit for Rand Paul
article_text: Almost exactly a year ago, stepping off a plane into the Nashville airport, I nearly collided with a curly-haired, middle-aged man stationed near the gate entrance. I could hardly fail to recognize Rand Paul, the Republican senator from Kentucky: He seemed to be the only person in the terminal wearing a dark business suit, and he was speaking intently into a cellphone. So far as I could tell, no one was with him and nobody had recognized him—or if they did, they chose to leave him alone, for his manner was not encouraging to...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Philip Terzian writes that the Senate is a more natural political fit for Rand Paul than the presidential-campaign trail.
twitter.title: A More Natural Political Fit for Rand Paul

article_summary:
I could hardly fail to recognize Rand Paul, the Republican senator from Kentucky: He seemed to be the only person in the terminal wearing a dark business suit, and he was speaking intently into a cellphone.
Almost exactly a year ago, stepping off a plane into the Nashville airport, I nearly collided with a curly-haired, middle-aged man stationed near the gate entrance.
So far as I could tell, no one was with him and nobody had recognized him—or if they did, they chose to leave him alone, for his manner was not encouraging to...
